texts.value: Sodium- and chloride-dependent glycine transporter (PubMed:25480793, PubMed:8226790). Terminates the action of glycine by its high affinity sodium-dependent reuptake into presynaptic terminals (PubMed:8226790). May be responsible for the termination of neurotransmission at strychnine-sensitive glycinergic synapses (PubMed:8226790)

reaction.name: glycine(out) + chloride(out) + 3 Na(+)(out) = glycine(in) + chloride(in) + 3 Na(+)(in)

texts.value: Specifically expressed in spinal cord, brain stem, and to a lesser extent in the cerebellum
Belongs to the sodium:neurotransmitter symporter (SNF) (TC 2.A.22) family. SLC6A5 subfamily

features.description: Loss of glycine transport. Retained in the endoplasmic reticulum due to defective processing and trafficking to the cell surface.

citation.title: Cloning and expression of a spinal cord- and brain-specific glycine transporter with novel structural features.
Isoforms of sodium dependent type 2 glycine transporter.
Genome sequence of the Brown Norway rat yields insights into mammalian evolution.
Quantitative maps of protein phosphorylation sites across 14 different rat organs and tissues.

referencePositions: IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS]

citation.title: Molecular basis of the dominant negative effect of a glycine transporter 2 mutation associated with hyperekplexia.

properties.value: Expressed in cerebellum and 6 other cell types or tissues
